issue.summary: Use FragmentContainerView instead of the <fragment> tag
issue.explanation: FragmentContainerView replaces the <fragment> tag as the preferred way of adding fragments via XML. Unlike the <fragment> tag, FragmentContainerView uses a normal `FragmentTransaction` under the hood to add the initial fragment, allowing further FragmentTransaction operations on the FragmentContainerView and providing a consistent timing for lifecycle events.

issue.message: A newer version of com.google.android.gms:play-services-maps than 17.0.1 is available: 18.0.2
issue.explanation: This detector looks for usages of libraries where the version you are using is not the current stable release. Using older versions is fine, and there are cases where you deliberately want to stick with an older version. However, you may simply not be aware that a more recent version is available, and that is what this lint check helps find.

issue.message: This `<FrameLayout>` can be replaced with a `<merge>` tag
issue.summary: FrameLayout can be replaced with `<merge>` tag
issue.explanation: If a `<FrameLayout>` is the root of a layout and does not provide background or padding etc, it can often be replaced with a `<merge>` tag which is slightly more efficient. Note that this depends on context, so make sure you understand how the `<merge>` tag works before proceeding.

issue.message: Test is ignored without giving any explanation
issue.explanation: Ignoring a test without a reason makes it difficult to figure out the problem later. Please define an explicit reason why it is ignored, and when it can be resolved.
